sn3.12:1.2: Now at that time five kings headed by Pasenadi were amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation, and this discussion came up among them:
sn3.12:1.5: “Sights are the best of sensual pleasures!”
sn3.12:1.14: Since those kings were unable to convince each other,
sn3.12:2.2: “Come, good sirs, let’s go to the Buddha and ask him about this.
sn3.12:2.3: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
sn3.12:3.1: Then those five kings headed by Pasenadi went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. King Pasenadi reported their conversation to the Buddha, and said,
sn3.12:3.14: “Sir, what’s the best of sensual pleasures?”
sn3.12:4.1: “Great king, which kind of sensual stimulation is best is defined by which is most agreeable, I say.
sn3.12:4.2: The very same sights that are agreeable to some are disagreeable to others.
sn3.12:4.3: When you’re happy with certain sights, as you’ve got all you wished for, you don’t want any other sight that’s better or finer.
sn3.12:4.4: For you, those sights are perfect

sn3.12:8.2: When you’re happy with certain touches, as you’ve got all you wished for, you don’t want any other touch that’s better or finer.
sn3.12:8.3: For you, those touches are perfect
sn3.12:9.1: Now at that time the lay follower Candanaṅgalika was sitting in that assembly.
sn3.12:9.2: Then he got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
sn3.12:9.3: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn3.12:9.4: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn3.12:10.1: Then the lay follower Candanaṅgalika extolled the Buddha in his presence with an appropriate verse:
sn3.12:11.2: that blooms in the morning, its fragrance unfaded—
sn3.12:11.4: bright as the sun in the sky!”
sn3.12:12.1: Then those five kings clothed Candanaṅgalika with five upper robes.
sn3.12:12.2: And Candanaṅgalika in turn endowed the Buddha with those robes.
